tweet: Fisheries are an important part of our economy in NW Oregon. That's why I helped secure $300 million for fisheries disaster funding in the CARES Act. This week @NOAAFisheries announced that Oregon will receive nearly $16m and West Coast Tribes will receive more than $5m. https://t.co/YEv76Nb0Ep

Housing is a basic right and I’m fighting to make sure everyone can keep a roof over their head during this difficult time. I strongly support the Emergency Rental Assistance & Rental Market Stability Act, which was introduced today to provide #RentReliefNow. https://t.co/dBe4AnmCuK

Today #AhmaudArbery would have been celebrating his birthday. Tragically he was murdered doing something millions of people do every day – he went out for a run. 
https://t.co/ploqJbz18G

This month will continue to be nerve-wracking for many as rent & mortgages are due a second time during this pandemic. Families & individuals were already struggling to cover housing costs before this crisis, and they now face painful decisions about how to pay for necessities.
Outrageous. The Department of Education is continuing to garnish the wages of student loan borrowers during the pandemic even after the CARES Act banned them from doing so. https://t.co/m2brCU5e02

Please join @ORDOJ, the Oregon Law Center and me for a webinar tomorrow about the resources that are available to help protect consumers during COVID-19. We’ll talk about housing, direct payments, resources to address domestic violence, and more. https://t.co/wJGAVDWw8d https://t.co/wD2QCiS8k4
Sec. DeVos and @usedgov should be helping students, families, educators, & schools deal with a pandemic of unprecedented proportion...

This EPA Brownfields grant will help Metro accelerate the clean-up & redevelopment of the Tigard Triangle, an area w/ great potential for housing & businesses that will benefit our growing community. I was proud to advocate for OR to receive this funding. https://t.co/bBlQqdZLyo

I want to express my gratitude to Oregon nurses for all you do in our communities each and every day, especially during these challenging times. I see you and I’m fighting in Congress to make sure you have all you need to stay safe. #NationalNursesWeek @OregonNurses https://t.co/DPfviWOyci

When families can go back to work, the economic crisis won’t end if they don’t have access to child care. I’m continuing to fight for $50 billion in next COVID-19 relief package to address the specific child care needs in Oregon and around the country.

It’s the National Day of Awareness for Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls. 

Native women face tragically high rates of violence, sexual assault, and murder. We must strive to better understand the institutional racism & systemic inequalities in Native communities.

It’s a challenging time and a lot of things have changed, but one thing that hasn’t changed is our appreciation for teachers. Thank you for all you do to meet the needs of our students and families. #TeacherAppreciationWeek #ThankATeacher https://t.co/wH9P9Tv90r

Families in NW Oregon and across the country are hurting and it is clear we must do much more to help them. I'm fighting for child care, assistance with paying utilities, monthly direct payments of $2,000+, and more in Congress during this crisis.

I have great appreciation for my friend and colleague @RepGraceMeng and I thank her for her leadership fighting discrimination.

Venues, performers, and the workers who support them are important to our community and the economy. They were among the first to be affected by distancing requirements, and I'm working to get the resources they need to get through this pandemic.

During the #COVID19 outbreak, some companies & individuals are using deceptive practices to take advantage of consumers by price gouging. In Oregon, we are fortunate to have laws that can level the playing field.

We are facing a severe worker safety crisis. Workers on the frontlines of #COVID19 lack access the workplace protections needed to stay safe. On #WorkersMemorialDay we honor the workers who have died on the job and recommit to fighting for robust workplace safety standards.

Any day now the Supreme Court could rule on President Trump’s plan to end #DACA. This decision by the administration is heartless and, if upheld, would be catastrophic for America’s efforts in fighting #COVID19.
Ramadan Mubarak. I wish a blessed month to those in our wonderful Muslim community.

In the wake of this unprecedented pandemic, Congress acted swiftly to pass the CARES Act to provide funding for our communities, incl. hospitals & healthcare facilities, schools, states & localities, & small businesses, but the funding was not at all sufficient to meet the need.

Today I’m back in DC to vote for critical funding our small businesses and health care providers need right now, and for more testing. It’s important, but not enough. I’ll keep advocating until NW Oregonians have the support they need. I am here for you. #CoronavirusRelief https://t.co/UhxSRB3L6Q

Essential workers need workplace standards to protect their health & well-being, especially during #COVID19. I've joined my @EdLaborCmte colleagues in introducing the COVID-19 Every Worker Protection Act to direct @OSHA_DOL to establish an emergency standard to keep workers safe. https://t.co/CoCEOawpde
Thanks to the @SHChronicle for this positive news, and thanks to  Cascades Tissue in Scappoose for helping our communities. This is what Oregon values are all about. https://t.co/PISShLl62t

On the 50th anniversary of #EarthDay, we unite behind a common goal of implementing bold, science-driven policies to tackle the #ClimateCrisis. As a member of @ClimateCrisis, one of my top priorities in Congress is protecting our planet for future generations. #ForTheLoveOfEarth https://t.co/pKfgrxYPFw

Older adults and people with disabilities are at the highest risk during this pandemic, but they often face the greatest challenges to accessing the support and resources they need to stay home and stay healthy.

There’s still time to sign up for my #EarthDay webinar with @ClimateCrisis Chair @USRepKCastor & a panel of environment & labor leaders.
